CLIFF class & functions

Cliff source code on GitHub

DataContainer

class DataContainer.DataContainer(S_df, S, W, Y, n_dose=7, dC=None, dlabs=None)

Bases: object

Allows to load all necessary matrices and vectors.

Parameters

  • C – single-cell expression matrix, can be in following format : * a dense 2D numpy.ndarray

  • a – array of normalized alphas (alpha_tilde). The sum of all alpha_tilde over all cells should be 1 for every patients.

  • y – array of drug response as survival rate (ratio of cells that survive the given drug treatment).

  • dC – doubled matrix C. Half of the matrix is associated with label = 1 and other half with label = 0.

  • dlabs – doubled label array. Half of the array is equal to 1 and other half to 0.

check_input(S, W, Y)

Cliff

class Cliff.Cliff(DC, n_iter, param_C=1, n_fold_cv=1, PI_true=None, print_steps=True)

Bases: object

Launch the Expectation-Maximization algorithm by using arrays / matrices provided in the object DC (class DataContainer defined above).

Parameters

  • DC – DataContainer object containing input matrix, alphas and target survival rate y

  • n_iter – integer defining the number of iteration to be used during the EM algorithm

class Cliff.Cliff_CV(DC, n_iter, param_C=1, PI_true=None, print_steps=True)

Bases: object

Launch CLIFF method with or without cross-validation. It also create the container with the required data.

Parameters

  • DC – DataContainer object containing input matrix, alphas and target survival rate y

  • n_iter – integer defining the number of iteration to be used during the EM algorithm
